summary: Federal agencies provide technical assistance to help grant recipients improve their ability to manage grant programs—such as training on project monitoring and evaluation. We reviewed how the Departments of Education, Health and Human Services, and Labor provide this assistance. We found that these agencies provided technical assistance through various means, including one-on-one instruction, live group events, and web-based information/guidance. Agencies also tailored their assistance to...
title: Grants Management: Agencies Provided Many Types of Technical Assistance and Applied Recipients' Feedback
